name: Grupotel Gran Vista & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gran Vista from 31st Aug until 11 Sept. The hotel is excellent. Loved the large gardens, where you could always get a sunbed. Lots of pine and olive trees for shade if you wanted it. The 2 outdoor pools are great, one standard square pool, but the second pool is a lagoon style, with a waterfall and an island in the middle. Didnt find it a problem at all with majority of German guests - would only be a prob if you had children and wanted them to go to Kids club, as the nannies only seemed to speak German. Food was very good, buffet style. Did get busy, and you then had to queue for certain dishes. Evening entertainment varied, one night Chinese acrobats who were very good, flamenco dancers, a male singer another night. My tip when booking any hotel is always to request a pool view and a high floor, they don't charge any extra, and you then don't run the risk of having a view overlooking a road. Do not change up Traveller's Cheques at hotel reception as they take 10% commission. In town you can change for only 2%.
reviews.title: Well worth booking at this hotel
Good 4* Hote - with a couple of exceptions!l
reviews.text: Second time been to this hotel and have enjoyed both holidays with the exception of: This is a Thomson Platinum hotel and therefore guests should get priority drop-off. For the second year running we had a lovely tour of the resort and were dropped off 4th which was an absloute nonsense as we actually drove straight past the hotel. Mind, it was slightly better than last year when we dropped off at four hotels in Alcudia before even getting to Picafort. Had a bit of a grumble to Thomson last year as there were other issues but they obviously fail to address them. The kids club is still a no-go for non German kids, and I felt that the quality of the evening meals had dropped slightly (loved the breakfasts though, lots of choice). The frienliness of staff was much improved and the pool/communal areas are really nice.

Just returned from a week in the Gran Vista, Can Picafort and was amazed at how lovely the hotel was. We was a bit worried about going as we'd read lots of reviews saying that the hotel was mostly German and that the staff didn't speak very good English. The hotel was in fact 95% German but this didn't affect our holiday at all as they were very friendly and polite, also all the staff spoke very good English as well as German and were extremly polite and helpful. We had a view across the pool with the sea in the distance. Our room was very clean with maid service daily. The pools were absolutely amazing, lots of different ones to choose from. The buffet style breakfast and dinner catered for everyone including nut allergy sufferers of which one of our party was. The head chef was brilliant, always on hand to advise what food was ok for the nut sufferer and even went to the extent of making a special desert for them. If you get a chance make sure you make use of the free spa, we didn't have any treatment but used the pool and jacuzzi and ice bath. Can't recommend this hotel more highly and will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Just after spending day 10 fantastic days at the gran vista. The food was excellent with a wide Varity to suit all tastes and with the many themed nights there was always something a bit different .the pool areas were superb and there was always a sun bed available no matter what time of day you went down [no putting towels out at 6 o clock in this hotel] the bar areas were very good especially the roof top bar which had views over the sea and can pickafort. The service was of a very high standard throughout the hotel and all staff were very friendly .we stayed in the apartment accommodation which was of ample size for 2 adults and 2 children ,as other people have mentioned this hotel is 90% German and all the better for it this was one of the most relaxed holidays we have had and will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: The Gran Vista is a great hotel. The food is absolutely dreadful and unless they changed the chef for our visit I find it hard to believe that so many people rated it highly.
reviews.title: Food DREADFUL, everything else FAB!

reviews.text: We booked our trip, 2 adults and 1 three year old boy, via "on the beach." as half board. The price was good enough to stay for 8 nights for the same as you would normally pay for 7. We wanted a quality hotel and thought that this would do the trick having read some other reviews. We were aware this would be mainly German oriented but that did not worry us dispite none of us speaking German except as it turned out our 3 year old was very fluent with the waiters and other kids!
reviews.title: Badingoo's Paradise

reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and on the whole spoke english once they realised where we were from. The food was buffet style and quite varied. There was very little queuing and the food was of a good quality and fresh, some being cooked in front of you. The waiters made a point of remembering you and took the time to get to know our 3 year old.
reviews.title: coeliac delight

likes.liked: — everything especially the food, the spa and the variety of pools

reviews.text: Our room was a twin made up into a triple, perhaps a little smaller than we excected but the bath room was spot on and we had a balcony over looking the pool. It was cleaned to a very good standard daily and had good air con.
reviews.title: We thought we were going to Spain!

likes.disliked: — Catered mostly for German Holiday makers, approximately ony 2% British.

reviews.text: The hotel has quite an array of pools, 6 out door and 2 indoor. The out door ones have shallow lead ins which are ideal for a small child. The small kids pools were nice and warm and the larger ones OK. The pools really made the hotel stand out. We didn't try the spa but had a look in and it did look very good! No problems with sun beds. Reserving them is not allowed.
reviews.title: Mixed reviews, thought about cancelling...

likes.liked: — high standard throughout, great pool complex and spa
likes.disliked: — spa got very busy around 5, lots of old nakedness not a pretty sight!!

reviews.text: There is a daily kids club which we only took advantage of on the last day which was a mistake. The "teachers" made a point of speaking English and involving our child. He has come back with a German CD and now makes us play German Badingoo songs (the kids club anthem) in the house and car!
reviews.title: Reality check

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Gran Vista. The hotel is modern and spotlessly clean. All the staff that we encountered were professional and pleasant. We asked in advance for a pool view room and that is what we were given. We only had breakfast at the hotel, but there was a wide range of good quality food both hot and cold. Prospective British guests should note that the hotel is 99.9% German and the staff will invariably speak to you in German first simply because of the sheer number of Germans there. Once you let them know that you are an English speaker there is no problem. We enjoy seeing / being amongst other nationalities on holiday so we really enjoyed it. The other guests seemed to be pleasant middle class couples and families of all ages and contrary to some of the rubbish written in reviews of hotels where Germans stay they are NOT arrogant, NOT rude and neither do they push people out of the way in queues etc.. in fact neither do they have two heads! We booked this hotel on the strength of it having BBC1 / 2 & ITV in case the weather was bad (and for two days the weather WAS bad!!!!) - unfortunately during the time we were there all three channels were out of order!
reviews.title: Nice hotel - pleasant resort

reviews.text: Can Picafort is a small resort on the north coast about an hour from Palma airport. As it is still out of season, lots of places were closed so it was very quiet, but I would imagine that in Summer it is a very nice little resort. Someone in an earlier report mentions its ok if you like the 'Blackpool theme' - sorry but I don't get the point of this comment. The British are very much in a minority here and it felt quite Spanish really so please don't get the impression that this place is tacky because it isn't. There are a few British bars but they are tucked away in side streets and you would have to go out of your way to find them. We transferred to the hotel using ResortHoppa. Their shuttle bus transfer service was excellent and took us to the hotel & picked us up from there on the way back. We had the misfortune to visit Alcudia a few miles round the bay. This is an appallingly dirty, run down resort which only seemed to be full of Chinese restaurants and ghastly British bars( plus the usual footie shirt wearers etc..). The port / marina area was a bit nicer and more cosmopolitan. We got the bus there at 1.35 euros each but a taxi back cost us 12 euros (plus 2 euro tip) however I would have gladly paid 100 euros just to get out of that hell hole!!!! All in all - a very nice hotel, pleasant resort and a nice short break away from work!
reviews.title: Not that good

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, but not really a four stars hotel, not for it service. The hotel is near a very busy road which you have to cross to go to the beach. That makes things difficult if you have children with you. After crossing the road you have another 10 minutes walk to get to the beach. The surroundings of the hotel are not nice at all, the hotel caters mainly for germans. Nothing against them, but it was difficult for our little ones, as the clubs are run in german, We ended by moving to another Thomson hotel, right on the beach, very safe, on the nicest area of Can Picafort (Son Baulo), with a lovely kids club....and cheaper.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — Clean, modern, great spa and grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can really only echo the sentiments of other reviewers regarding this hotel. It is one of the best hotels of this type that I have stayed in while travelling abroad. We collected a hire car at the airport and drove to the hotel - a trip of about 40 minutes and very straightforward. There was a large hotel car park. Reception was very efficient and friendly, with english newspapers for sale and a high standard of english spoken by staff. There were 4 internet stations in the extended reception area which were coin operated (1euro for 15 mins). There were 4 lifts and we never had to wait for one for long. The view from our room was poor, the only downside really, but I heard that other guests had swapped rooms with no problem - we just stayed put! We were looking out over the roof of the dining room. The room was modern, and all had a balcony with a table and reclining chairs. The bathroom was modern and well lit, with toiletries provided and a wall-mounted hairdryer, although if you don't like your hairdryers hot you might want to take your own. The beds were a bit hard but I counteracted that by putting the quilt underneath the bottom sheet - a vast improvement. The TV channels included BBC 1, BBC 2 and ITV - a Godsend as the weather was pretty poor for much of our stay. The grounds were lovely, with one large square pool outside the door and a series of organic pools linked by waterfalls in the centre of tree-shaded lawns. There were always plenty of sun-beds available to put where you wanted. There was also a children's paddling pool. The children's club seemed to be very well run and although there were mainly german guests at the hotel, the staff were tri-lingual and spoke english and spanish too. The health spa (in a seperate building) was fantastic, with an indoor pool (there was also an indoor pool in the hotel), jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, hot room, ice room, plunge pool, relaxation room, different types of shower, and jacuzzi beds. There were also thalassotherapy jets in the pool. All of these facilities were free. The sauna and steam room were only operational in the afternoon when no children were allowed, and the sauna could only be used naked, so not for the shy, although the german guests were obviously more used to being naked in front of others so there was no awkwardness. There were a variety of massages and beauty treatments available too, with prices comparable to those in the UK. I had a salt and oil exfoliation massage and enjoyed every second. Probably the highlight of our stay was the food. There was always a fantastic choice of food, some staples always available such as salads, grilled chicken breast, grilled fish, and chips, but also a large variety of other dishes which changed nightly, with a theme, for example, Mediterranean or Caribbean. Always 2 soups, lots of pates and cheeses, different types of fresh bread, and a large selection of desserts, although these were sometimes a bit "samey". Breakfasts were wonderful too, lots to choose from, hot and cold, and the rice pudding was a revelation! There was never a shortage of tables and if you wanted to, in one dining room you could keep the same table for the length of your stay. There were two bars, one on the ground floor where there was nightly entertainment (as another reviewer has said, a bit hit and miss), and a rooftop bar which had a more relaxed atmosphere. There were also plenty of places in public areas to sit and relax in comfortable chairs. I would not hesitate to stay at the Gran Vista again and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Hotel lovely, resort like Blackpool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of Sept. Although it is a nice hotel, I am not sure whether it should be Thomson Platinum?! The hotel is lovely and clean, rooms lovely and bathroom really modern with excellent double shower!! TV in room which had BBC1, BB2 and ITV which was good to catch up with the news (and the soaps!). Food was good, i'm a fussy eater but never had any problem finding something I liked and there was a different theme every night so not repetitive. The hotel has mostly German guests there, however this did not bother us. Although, the kids club was in German which I thought was not acceptable for a hotel that Thomson promote in their Platinum brochure.....i would not have been impressed if I had children!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — The size of the accomodation and variety of things to do

aka: Grupotel Gran Vista Hotel Ca`n Picafort
description: 400 m away from the Can Picafort beach. Wellness & fitness Spa. Attractive relax and health programmes. Rooms & Apartments: air-conditioning. Sat-TV. Minibar. Terrace. Apartments: Living room with sleeping-couch and kitchen. Sport & Leisure: swimming pools. Children's pools. Swimming lessons. Bicycle Center. tennis courts. Minigolf. Miniclub. Evening shows. Gastronomy: Theme buffets. Show Cooking. Pool-Bistro. Panorama & Lounge bar with terrace. Special Services: Discounts on green fees at several golf clubs in Mallorca. Car rental. Internet.
